metadata.titel_preek: The Living God More Than “Tastes Great ... Less Filling”

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Living God acts as the source of life and transformation, breaking through human deadlocks (ideological and existential) to provide safety, justice, and a purified conscience.

subject.identificatie: The Living God / The Easter God
tekstueel_bewijs: It is this God who brought life into heaven and earth
The living God emerged from the power of death on Easter day
God is always doing what the world judges to be impossible

object.identificatie: Life-giving reality (Safety, Happiness, Justice, Purified Conscience)
tekstueel_bewijs: permit contaminated people to commune with God
freedom that the world cannot give

zender.identificatie: The Living God (as the source of all 'Newness')
tekstueel_bewijs: God is lively as help and hope so powerful
the giver of justice and food

ontvanger.identificatie: The Church / Humanity (specifically the 'contaminated', 'oppressed', and 'ideologically stuck')
tekstueel_bewijs: the neighbor who waits for emancipation

helper.identificatie: The 'Self-giving' of Christ / The Life-giving Spirit

tegenstander.identificatie: Deathly shadows, Ideological Slogans, Human Self-Sufficiency
tekstueel_bewijs: power of denial and loss and silence
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is identified as 'the power of death' and 'deadly shadows of hopelessness,' which only an 'Easter surge' can overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The response of the believer to the gift: moving from 'dead works' to 'worship' and 'neighbor-love'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon emphasizes that receiving the gift (Primary) precedes and enables the ability to be 'creatures who transform life' (Secondary).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Christ's Blood → Easter God ← Power of Death/Pride

voorbeelden_god_subject: The LORD sets the prisoners free
The living God emerged from the power of death
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We shout slogans at each other
if you are using your energy to become a powerful agent of control

voorbeelden: summons to move beyond our preferred posture
God is always doing what the world judges to be impossible
freedom that the world cannot give

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily focused on God's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) to do the impossible, contrasting it with human 'non-pouvoir' (inability).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'Dead Works' of ideological shouting (Conservative vs Progressive) toward the 'Living God' who resolves the tension through the 'Impossible' act of Easter.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved not by human compromise, but by the Subject-switch to the Easter God who encompasses both holiness and justice.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death and 'dead works' are treated as ontological barriers that only God can break.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject of transformation and salvation, while humans are positioned as receivers of a gift they cannot produce.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Progressives... gladly take on God’s work as their own

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It is this God who blows the winds of justice
Be on the receiving end. Be on the other end of the gift of life

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The sermon explicitly rejects the idea that we can 'hustle' our way to safety, pointing instead to God's action.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'demanding ethic' and ideological exhaustion.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic emphasis on God's sustaining and redeeming power.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The integration of the priestly (Hebrews) and prophetic (Psalm 146) through the lens of the 'Living God' is structurally sound.
spanning_punten: The transition from 'receiving' to 'transforming' in the final paragraph is brief.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: emerged from the power of death... broke all the power of denial

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'carrier' of life-giving power to the believer.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject. The actantial engine is powered by God's 'Pouvoir' (Power) rather than the hearer's 'Devoir' (Duty).

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might still feel like the 'Subject' of the ideological conflict described in sections I and II.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Deepen the identification with the 'Orphan and Widow' (the Receiver).
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Use more 'we' language when describing the helpless actants in the Psalm.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly identified as Death and Pride.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God gives life) → Ethics (We transform life).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of theocentric preaching that uses structural tension to highlight the necessity of divine agency.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'beer commercial' metaphor, Greimas shows that the metaphor serves to deconstruct human agency (Subject) in favor of Divine action.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the meaning of 'blood' in Hebrews; semiotics focuses on 'blood' as a Helper that enables the Subject (God) to reach the Object (Communion).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Conservative vs. Progressive' debate is actually a conflict of 'Senders' (Values) that is only resolved by a 'Subject-switch' to the Easter God.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'If-Then' trap of moralism by framing the 'summons' as a call to 'give up' human effort rather than to increase it.
